alert.note: Alert for Maricopa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued June 23 at 5:08PM MST until June 23 at 5:30PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A DUST STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM MST FOR MARICOPA COUNTY... At 508 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Lake Pleasant to 12 miles west of White Tank Mountain Park, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Less than one quarter mile visibility. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 89 and 111. US Highway 60 between mile markers 116 and 139. AZ Route 74 between mile markers 1 and 27. Locations impacted include... Surprise, Buckeye, Tonopah, Wittmann, Circle City, Sun City West, Lake Pleasant, White Tank Mountain Park, Beardsley, Morristown, Palo Verde Nuclear Generation Station, Wintersburg and Vistancia. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, then pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
